intro: Scabiosa ispartaca, commonly known as the Italian sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Scabiosa ispartaca is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
